required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Pre-operative Point-of-Care Focused Cardiac Ultrasound on Patient Outcome - a Prospective, Randomized, Clinical Study (PreOPFOCUS)

brief_summary.textblock: Mortality and morbidity remain high after non-cardiac surgery. Known risk factors include age, high ASA grade and emergency surgery. Point-of-care focused cardiac ultrasound may elucidate pathology and potential hemodynamic compromise unknown to handling physicians. This study aims to investigate the effects of focused cardiac ultrasound in high-risk patients undergoing non-cardiac surgery with respect to clinical endpoints.

detailed_description.textblock:
In non-cardiac surgery major risk factors for morbidity and mortality include ASA classification, age, acute surgery and pre-existing cardiopulmonary disease. These risk factors are sometimes readily available and, along with the type of surgery, allow anaesthesiologists to tailor anaesthetic drugs, fluid therapy and monitoring to the individual patient need. However, cardiopulmonary disease may be occult or masked by other patient-related incapacities. Hence, identification of cardiopulmonary disease is an important priority during the pre-operative anaesthesia evaluation. Routine pre-operative anaesthesia evaluation includes screening with auscultation, blood tests and often electrocardiography. However, these exams are insensitive for detecting cardiopulmonary diseases that may be life threatening during anaesthesia, including ischaemia, heart valve disease and left ventricular hypertrophy.
Point-of-care focused cardiac ultrasound (FOCUS) is claimed to be an effective method for filling out this obvious gap in rapid diagnostic capability, as FOCUS can detect both structural and functional cardiac disease as well as pleural effusion. FOCUS performed by anaesthesiologists can identify unknown pathologies in surgical patients and identification of these enables prediction of perioperative morbidity. Although pre-operative FOCUS has been shown to alter anaesthetic patient management, it remains unclear whether the application of FOCUS actually impacts patient outcome.
This study aims to clarify whether pre-operative FOCUS changes clinical outcomes in high-risk patients undergoing acute, non-cardiac surgery.
The hypothesis of the study is that pre-operative FOCUS reduces the fraction of patients admitted to hospital for more than 10 days or are dead within 30 days after high risk, non-cardiac surgery.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Preoperative point-of-care focused cardiopulmonary ultrasound (FOCUS) Patients are to be randomised in a 1:1 ratio to either 1) FOCUS prior to anaesthesia or 2) no FOCUS performed (standard treatment).

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients admitted to hospital ≥ 10 days or dead within 30 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 180 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the number of days admitted to hospital from the date of surgery (included)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Re-admissions to hospital (no) within 90 days (no)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Length of stay including re-admissions to hospital within 90 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Death ≤ 30 days & ≤ 90 days (no)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Intensive care treatment (hours)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative ventilator treatment (hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Admittance to the post-operative care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 day after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Admittance to the post-operative care unit (hours)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Development of acute kidney injury (AKI) (stage 1,2 & 3, defined by th KDIGO creatinine criteria within seven days of surgery)

secondary_outcome.measure: Accumulated intra- and postoperative infusion of norepinephrine, epinephrine, phenylephrine, ephedrine, dobutamine, dopamine and other vasoactive drugs.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia til end of anaesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Accumulated intra- and postoperative infusion of norepinephrine, epinephrine, phenylephrine, ephedrine, dobutamine, dopamine and other vasoactive drugs (mg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia til end of anaesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Accumulated fluid balance until end of surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From anaeshetic visit to start of anaesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Formal echocardiography's (1) ordered and (2) actually performed in total and secondarily due to preoperative FOCUS (no).

secondary_outcome.measure: Surgery cancellations due to preoperative FOCUS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before start of anaeshesia
secondary_outcome.description: Surgery cancellations in total and secondarily due to preoperative FOCUS (no)

secondary_outcome.measure: Surgery postponements due to preoperative FOCUS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days of preoperative anaesthetic visit
secondary_outcome.description: Surgery postponements in total and secondarily due to preoperative FOCUS (no).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From FOCUS to the start of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Surgery changes in total and secondarily due to preoperative FOCUS (no, type).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the day before surgery to the day following surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Troponin I

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to start of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in anesthetic practice/perianesthetic care DUE to preoperative FOCUS. Includes both step up/step down

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From FOCUS to start of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Formal echocardiographies ordered prior to surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From FOCUS to the start of anaesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Volume infusion prior to anesthesia. Both in total and facilitated by FOCUS

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From FOCUS to the start of anaesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Conversion of Anaesthesia type from primary anesthetic visit to actually performed. Both in total and facilitated by FOCUS.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to end of anaesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Step up and step down in anesthetic monitoring. Both in total and facilitated by FOCUS. Includes extra intravenous lines inserted including central venous catheters, arterial lines inserted, change to 5-lead ECG, vasopressors infused with anaesthetic induction

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to end of anaesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Anesthesia time

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of surgery to end of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Surgery time

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiogenic pulmonary oedema within 30 days of surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: New onset cardiac arrhythmia of any kind.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Non-fatal cardiac arrest regardless of cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Anastomotic breakdown (deep or superficial)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Myocardial infarction as defined by the universal criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral stroke

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Pulmonary embolism with radiological confirmation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From end of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative haemorrhage demanding blood transfusion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Gastrointestinal bleed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Pneumonia

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From end of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Surgical site infection (superficial or deep)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From end of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary tract infection

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From end of anaesthesia to 30 days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Infektion, source unknown.

arm_group.description: Patients allocated to FOCUS will receive a preoperative FOCUS examination in conjunction with a standard anesthetic preoperative evaluation.
Patients allocated til control arm will receive a standard anesthetic preoperative evaluation according to hospitals' standards.

intervention.description: A ultrasound of the heart and pleura will be performed. This provide information on Left ventricular systolic function Left ventricular diastolic function Right ventricular systolic function Right ventricular pressure overload Biventricular sizes Pathology of the mitral- and aortic valves Pericardial fluid Gross fluid status Pleural effusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled for emergency (< 6 hours) or urgent surgery (< 24 hours)15
- General or neuro-axial anaesthesia planned at the first anesthetic visit
- ASA classification 3 or 4.
- Age ≥ 65 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous surgery performed during current hospital admission (including transfers from other hospitals than Randers Regional Hospital/Hospital of Southern Jutland)
- Low risk surgery or expected surgery time < 30 minutes or endoscopies.
- Lack of consent from patient or proxy (in case of patient mental incapacity)
- Previous participation in the study. Pre-operative FOCUS not possible for logistical reasons or due to requirement for immediate surgery
Drop-out Criteria:
Patients who refuse participation after formal inclusion will drop out.
• Patients converted from a primary anaesthetic plan of general/neuro-axial anaesthesia to regional anaesthesia will not drop-out. -

patient_data.ipd_description: Protocol and statistical plan will be published in a peer-reviewed journal. Study results will be made available at a freely accessible online site.
